Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Thomas Moran Papers
Moran, Thomas
Moran, Thomas
WAG.166
4 Linear Feet in 5 boxes
undated Thomas Moran was the Safety Director for the Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2. This collection contains materials related to Local 1-2. Materials are in English 1 2 3
Historical/Biographical Note
Thomas Moran was the Safety Director for the Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2, and in this position worked with the White Lung Association, the New York Committee for Occupational Safety and Health to advocate for the removal of asbestos all over New York City.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Thomas Moran were transferred to New York University in 2000 by Thomas Moran. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Thomas Moran Papers; WAG 166; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Thomas Moran in 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 2000.012.
Scope and Contents
Documents related to Utility Workers of America, Local 1-2.
Industrial safety |z New York (State) |z New York Consolidated Edison Company of New York, inc. New York Committee for Occupational Safety and Health Utility Workers Union of America. Local 1-2 Moran, Thomas
